location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Gideon Colquhoun, Acting Assistant in Charge of the Residency at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bussora Residency that the Pattamai Barbara[ Barabara Paramai] has brought word to Bushire of a fleet of fifteen boats anchored off the Island of Carrack [Khārk, Jazīreh-ye], however it is believed that these were likely to have been merchant vessels rather than pirates. It further notes that the vessel has been permitted to take on extra sepoys has a precaution. Also reported in the letter is a failed pirate attack on the HCC Psyche.
